intro: Decastrophia inconspicua, commonly known as the inconspicuous decastrophia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. Its leaves are simple and ovate, with a slightly hairy texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
